text: Michael Lang (December 11, 1944 â€“ January 8, 2022) was an American concert promoter, producer, and artistic manager. He was best known as a co-creator of the Woodstock Music & Art Festival in 1969. Lang died from non-Hodgkin lymphoma at a hospital in New York City, on January 8, 2022, at the age of 77. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2022 deaths Category:People from Brooklyn Category:Deaths from non-Hodgkin lymphoma
title: Michael Lang (producer)
